intro: Malcolmia hispida, commonly known as the hairy malcolm, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it produces clusters of yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Its ornamental value and drought tolerance make it a popular choice for xeriscaping.
